definitions.meaning: 延长、扩展（时间、空间、范围等的增加或延伸）
definitions.usage: 指将某事物的时间、空间或范围延长、扩大，常用于描述时间期限的推迟、物理空间的扩展或抽象范围的延伸。

examples.scene: 一名大学生因为论文写作进度落后，决定向教授申请额外的时间来完成作业。
examples.chineseIdea: 学生希望推迟提交论文的截止日期，以便有更多时间完善内容。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She had to @ @ @ on her essay deadline to polish her work.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She had to 「request an extension」 on her essay deadline to polish her work.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她不得不「请求延长」论文截止日期，以便完善她的工作。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：She asked to delay the deadline of her essay. 纠正：She requested an extension on her essay deadline.（‘delay’虽然也能表示推迟，但不如‘request an extension’在学术场景中更自然和正式。）

examples.scene: 一名员工因为项目复杂性超出预期，向经理说明需要更多时间来完成任务。
examples.chineseIdea: 员工希望得到额外的期限，以便确保项目质量。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The manager decided to @ @ @ for the project to ensure quality.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The manager decided to 「grant an extension」 for the project to ensure quality.
examples.chineseTranslation: 经理决定「给予延长」项目期限，以确保质量。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The manager allowed more time for the project. 纠正：The manager granted an extension for the project.（‘allow more time’虽然可理解，但在正式语境中不如‘grant an extension’精确。）

definitions.meaning: 扩展部分（物理或结构的附加部分）
definitions.usage: 指在物理空间或结构上添加的部分，例如建筑物的扩建或设备的附加组件。

examples.scene: 一家人觉得房子空间不足，决定在后院增加一个新房间。
examples.chineseIdea: 为了满足居住需求，房主希望扩建房屋，增加额外的居住空间。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: They decided to @ @ @ to their house to accommodate their growing family.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: They decided to 「build an extension」 to their house to accommodate their growing family.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他们决定「建造扩展部分」给房子，以适应不断增长的家庭需求。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：They want to make their house bigger. 纠正：They decided to build an extension to their house.（‘make bigger’过于笼统，‘build an extension’更具体且符合建筑语境。）

examples.scene: 一家餐馆为了接待更多顾客，计划在现有建筑旁增加一个露台区域。
examples.chineseIdea: 餐馆老板希望通过增加户外空间来提升营业能力。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The restaurant owner chose to @ @ @ to attract more customers.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The restaurant owner chose to 「add an extension」 to attract more customers.
examples.chineseTranslation: 餐馆老板选择「添加扩展部分」以吸引更多顾客。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The owner wants to enlarge the restaurant. 纠正：The owner chose to add an extension to the restaurant.（‘enlarge’不够具体，‘add an extension’更符合描述新增部分的语境。）

definitions.meaning: 电话分机（电话系统中的分机号码）
definitions.usage: 指在电话系统中用于连接特定办公室或个人的分机号码，常用于正式或商务场景。

examples.scene: 一名客户拨打公司总机，希望联系销售部门的负责人。
examples.chineseIdea: 客户需要通过分机号码直接联系到具体的部门或个人。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Please @ @ @ to speak with the sales manager.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Please 「dial an extension」 to speak with the sales manager.
examples.chineseTranslation: 请「拨打分机」以联系销售经理。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：Please call the number of the sales manager. 纠正：Please dial an extension to speak with the sales manager.（‘call the number’不够精确，‘dial an extension’更符合电话系统语境。）

examples.scene: 公司前台接到一通电话，需将呼叫转接到财务部门。
examples.chineseIdea: 前台需要将电话转接到正确的分机号码以便处理请求。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The receptionist will @ @ @ to connect you with the finance team.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The receptionist will 「transfer to an extension」 to connect you with the finance team.
examples.chineseTranslation: 前台将「转接到分机」以便您与财务团队联系。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The receptionist will move your call to the finance team. 纠正：The receptionist will transfer to an extension to connect you with the finance team.（‘move your call’不地道，‘transfer to an extension’更专业。）
